q: Eric Schmidt said he will`` focus wherever I can add the greatest value,'' such as partnerships and government affairs, and that he will remain`` an advisor to Larry Page and Sergey Brin .'' I have learned a ton from him over the years, Mr. Larry Page said of Mr. Eric Schmidt in a conference call.`` I can not be more excited about moving us forward, and we are really only at the beginning.'' Chrysler Canada, which owes about$ 1.7 billion to the federal and Ontario governments, says it is the first time that the company is voluntarily paying extra money to workers beyond contractual obligations. It's in recognition of an extraordinary performance of the industrial system of Chrysler in 2010, chief executive officer Sergio Marchionne told analysts after U.S. parent Chrysler reported its year-end results. to good relations with regulators has been communicating and countering misunderstandings about what Google does and does not do.`` We're trying to be as transparent and as collaborative as possible,'' Eric Schmidt said. We try to stay well within the safety zone of the way we're operating with respect to the legal issues and the competitive issues. We also argue very strongly that the things that we're doing are very pro-competitive, and I genuinely believe that, he said. Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will oversee strategic projects.
